LiteGraph.name: LiteGraph
LiteGraph.description: The Global Scope. It contains all the registered node classes.

LGraph.name: LGraph
LGraph.description: LGraph is the class that contain a full graph. We instantiate one and add nodes to it, and then we can run the execution loop.

LGraphNode.name: LGraphNode
LGraphNode.description: Base Class for all the node type classes

params.name: name
params.description: a name for the node

LGraphCanvas.name: LGraphCanvas
LGraphCanvas.description: marks as dirty the canvas, this way it will be rendered again

params.name: canvas
params.description: the canvas where you want to render (it accepts a selector in string format or the canvas itself)

params.name: graph
params.description: [optional]

params.name: options
params.description: [optional] { skip_rendering, autoresize }

classitems.description: Register a node class so it can be listed when the user wants to create a new one
classitems.name: registerNodeType

params.name: type
params.description: name of the node and path

params.name: base_class
params.description: class containing the structure of a node

classitems.description:
Adds this method to all nodetypes, existing and to be created
(You can add it to LGraphNode.prototype but then existing node types wont have it)
classitems.name: addNodeMethod

classitems.description: Create a node of a given type with a name. The node is not attached to any graph yet.
classitems.name: createNode

params.name: type
params.description: full name of the node class. p.e. "math/sin"

params.name: name
params.description: a name to distinguish from other nodes

params.name: options
params.description: to set options

classitems.description: Returns a registered node type with a given name
classitems.name: getNodeType

params.name: type
params.description: full name of the node class. p.e. "math/sin"

classitems.description: Returns a list of node types matching one category
classitems.name: getNodeType

params.name: category
params.description: category name

return.description: array with all the node classes

classitems.description: Returns a list with all the node type categories
classitems.name: getNodeTypesCategories

return.description: array with all the names of the categories

classitems.description: Removes all nodes from this graph
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: Attach Canvas to this graph
classitems.name: attachCanvas

classitems.description: Detach Canvas from this graph
classitems.name: detachCanvas

classitems.description: Starts running this graph every interval milliseconds.
classitems.name: start

params.name: interval
params.description: amount of milliseconds between executions, default is 1

classitems.description: Stops the execution loop of the graph
classitems.name: stop execution

classitems.description: Run N steps (cycles) of the graph
classitems.name: runStep

params.name: num
params.description: number of steps to run, default is 1

classitems.description:
Updates the graph execution order according to relevance of the nodes (nodes with only outputs have more relevance than
nodes with only inputs.
classitems.name: updateExecutionOrder

classitems.description: Returns the amount of time the graph has been running in milliseconds
classitems.name: getTime

return.description: number of milliseconds the graph has been running

classitems.description: Returns the amount of time accumulated using the fixedtime_lapse var. This is used in context where the time increments should be constant
classitems.name: getFixedTime

return.description: number of milliseconds the graph has been running

classitems.description:
Returns the amount of time it took to compute the latest iteration. Take into account that this number could be not correct
if the nodes are using graphical actions
classitems.name: getElapsedTime

return.description: number of milliseconds it took the last cycle

classitems.description: Sends an event to all the nodes, useful to trigger stuff
classitems.name: sendEventToAllNodes

params.name: eventname
params.description: the name of the event (function to be called)

params.name: params
params.description: parameters in array format

classitems.description: Adds a new node instasnce to this graph
classitems.name: add

params.name: node
params.description: the instance of the node

classitems.description: Removes a node from the graph
classitems.name: remove

params.name: node
params.description: the instance of the node

classitems.description: Returns a node by its id.
classitems.name: getNodeById

classitems.description: Returns a list of nodes that matches a class
classitems.name: findNodesByClass

params.name: classObject
params.description: the class itself (not an string)

return.description: a list with all the nodes of this type

classitems.description: Returns a list of nodes that matches a type
classitems.name: findNodesByType

params.name: type
params.description: the name of the node type

return.description: a list with all the nodes of this type

classitems.description: Returns a list of nodes that matches a name
classitems.name: findNodesByName

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the node to search

return.description: a list with all the nodes with this name

classitems.description: Returns the top-most node in this position of the canvas
classitems.name: getNodeOnPos

params.name: x
params.description: the x coordinate in canvas space

params.name: y
params.description: the y coordinate in canvas space

params.name: nodes_list
params.description: a list with all the nodes to search from, by default is all the nodes in the graph

return.description: a list with all the nodes that intersect this coordinate

classitems.description:
Assigns a value to all the nodes that matches this name. This is used to create global variables of the node that
can be easily accesed from the outside of the graph
classitems.name: setInputData

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the node

params.name: value
params.description: value to assign to this node

classitems.description: Returns the value of the first node with this name. This is used to access global variables of the graph from the outside
classitems.name: setInputData

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the node

classitems.description: returns if the graph is in live mode
classitems.name: isLive

classitems.description: Creates a Object containing all the info about this graph, it can be serialized
classitems.name: serialize

classitems.description: Configure a graph from a JSON string
classitems.name: configure

params.name: str
params.description: configure a graph from a JSON string

classitems.description: configure a node from an object containing the serialized info
classitems.name: configure

classitems.description: serialize the content
classitems.name: serialize

classitems.description: serialize and stringify
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description: get the title string
classitems.name: getTitle

classitems.description: sets the output data
classitems.name: setOutputData

classitems.description: retrieves the input data (data traveling through the connection) from one slot
classitems.name: getInputData

return.description: data or if it is not connected returns undefined

classitems.description: tells you if there is a connection in one input slot
classitems.name: isInputConnected

classitems.description: tells you info about an input connection (which node, type, etc)
classitems.name: getInputInfo

classitems.description: returns the node connected in the input slot
classitems.name: getInputNode

classitems.description: tells you info about an output connection (which node, type, etc)
classitems.name: getOutputInfo

classitems.description: tells you if there is a connection in one output slot
classitems.name: isOutputConnected

classitems.description: retrieves all the nodes connected to this output slot
classitems.name: getOutputNodes

classitems.description: Triggers an event in this node, this will trigger any output with the same name
classitems.name: trigger

params.name: event
params.description: name ( "on_play", ... ) if action is equivalent to false then the event is send to all

classitems.description: add a new property to this node
classitems.name: addProperty

params.name: type
params.description: string defining the output type ("vec3","number",...)

params.name: extra_info
params.description: this can be used to have special properties of the property (like values, etc)

classitems.description: add a new output slot to use in this node
classitems.name: addOutput

params.name: type
params.description: string defining the output type ("vec3","number",...)

params.name: extra_info
params.description: this can be used to have special properties of an output (label, special color, position, etc)

classitems.description: add a new output slot to use in this node
classitems.name: addOutputs

params.name: array
params.description: of triplets like [[name,type,extra_info],[...]]

classitems.description: remove an existing output slot
classitems.name: removeOutput

classitems.description: add a new input slot to use in this node
classitems.name: addInput

params.name: type
params.description: string defining the input type ("vec3","number",...), it its a generic one use 0

params.name: extra_info
params.description: this can be used to have special properties of an input (label, color, position, etc)

classitems.description: add several new input slots in this node
classitems.name: addInputs

params.name: array
params.description: of triplets like [[name,type,extra_info],[...]]

classitems.description: remove an existing input slot
classitems.name: removeInput

classitems.description: add an special connection to this node (used for special kinds of graphs)
classitems.name: addConnection

params.name: type
params.description: string defining the input type ("vec3","number",...)

params.name: pos
params.description: position of the connection inside the node

params.name: direction
params.description: if is input or output

classitems.description: computes the size of a node according to its inputs and output slots
classitems.name: computeSize

classitems.description: returns the bounding of the object, used for rendering purposes
classitems.name: getBounding

classitems.description: checks if a point is inside the shape of a node
classitems.name: isPointInsideNode

classitems.description: checks if a point is inside a node slot, and returns info about which slot
classitems.name: getSlotInPosition

return.description: if found the object contains { input|output: slot object, slot: number, link_pos: [x,y] }

classitems.description: returns the input slot with a given name (used for dynamic slots), -1 if not found
classitems.name: findInputSlot

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the slot

classitems.description: returns the output slot with a given name (used for dynamic slots), -1 if not found
classitems.name: findOutputSlot

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the slot

classitems.description: connect this node output to the input of another node
classitems.name: connect

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

params.name: node
params.description: the target node

params.name: target_slot
params.description: the input slot of the target node (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot, or -1 to connect a trigger)

classitems.description: disconnect one output to an specific node
classitems.name: disconnectOutput

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

params.name: target_node
params.description: the target node to which this slot is connected [Optional, if not target_node is specified all nodes will be disconnected]

classitems.description: disconnect one input
classitems.name: disconnectInput

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

classitems.description: returns the center of a connection point in canvas coords
classitems.name: getConnectionPos

params.name: is_input
params.description: true if if a input slot, false if it is an output

params.name: slot
params.description: (could be the number of the slot or the string with the name of the slot)

classitems.description: Collapse the node to make it smaller on the canvas
classitems.name: collapse

classitems.description: Forces the node to do not move or realign on Z
classitems.name: pin

classitems.description: clears all the data inside
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: assigns a graph, you can reasign graphs to the same canvas
classitems.name: setGraph

classitems.description: opens a graph contained inside a node in the current graph
classitems.name: openSubgraph

classitems.description: closes a subgraph contained inside a node
classitems.name: closeSubgraph

params.name: assigns
params.description: a graph

classitems.description: assigns a canvas
classitems.name: setCanvas

params.name: assigns
params.description: a canvas

classitems.description: Used to attach the canvas in a popup
classitems.name: getCanvasWindow

return.description: returns the window where the canvas is attached (the DOM root node)

classitems.description: starts rendering the content of the canvas when needed
classitems.name: startRendering

classitems.description: stops rendering the content of the canvas (to save resources)
classitems.name: stopRendering
